description: The Evaluation Framework Core orchestrates the evaluation process by generating events related to LLM and tool interactions. It utilizes the Event Handling Mixin to emit these events, which are captured by the LLM Event Monitoring component. This component processes the events and records critical metrics, providing the Evaluation Framework Core with the necessary data to inform its evaluation strategies and assess performance.

components.name: LLM Event Monitoring
components.description: This component is responsible for actively monitoring and recording events generated during LLM and tool interactions. It captures critical metrics such as token usage, tool calls, and errors, integrating directly into the execution flow to provide real-time performance data.

components.name: Event Handling Mixin
components.description: This component provides a standardized and reusable mechanism for other parts of the system to emit events. By offering a consistent interface, it ensures that events are generated uniformly, which is crucial for reliable capture by the monitoring system.

components.name: Evaluation Framework Core
components.description: This component establishes the foundational structure for evaluating the performance and correctness of LLM outputs and tool executions. It defines abstract classes and interfaces for specifying evaluation metrics, managing datasets, and orchestrating evaluation strategies.
